pylovo

  • Urbs Editor
  • generate_urbs_setup_editor.js
  • View page source

generate_urbs_setup_editor.js

GetUrbsSetupProperties()

function that fetches the urbsPropertyJSON file stored in the backend. The file defines all inputs for all features as well as tooltips, types and default values

Returns:

Promise to make sure functions during setup are called in order

SetupUrbsEditor()

main aggregate function for editor generation: All the different preparatory functions for each editor component are called here after the network data is retrieved from Flask

displayUrbsEditorNet(ppdata)

aggregate function for displaying the full network

Arguments:

  • ppdata (dict) – the grid data

addGeoJSONtoUrbsEditorMap(isLines, input_geoJSON, featureName)

creates a new geojson layer for leaflet map distinguishes between line (for lines and trafos) and circle marker (for buses and ext_grids) formats because line geojsons do not have the pointToLayer option

Arguments:

  • isLines (boolean) – distinguishes if the geometry we want to place on the map is a point or a line

  • input_geoJSON (geoJSON_FeatureCollection) – the data structure containing all our grid information

  • featureName (string) – name of the feature type to be added to the map (e.g. line, bus etc)

populateUrbsEditorLoadBusLists(htmlListName)
Arguments:

  • htmlListName (string) – name of the html select element that is supposed to be filled with the buses with attached loads

populateUrbsEditor(feature, propertiesToAdd, writebackFunction)

We create the form and div elements holding input fields and associated labels from scratch right after page load and attach them to the corresponding static editor div

Arguments:

  • feature (string) – name of the feature (i.e demand, process etc) for which input fields are to be generated

  • propertiesToAdd (dict) – properties for which inputs are created, as well as tooltips, types and default values loaded from the UrbsPropertiesJSON file fetched from the backend

  • writebackFunction (function) – since the storage objects for each feature may not be the same, we can pass a custom function for each feature that

populateUrbsNetworkEditorSecondaryFeature(primaryFeatureName, secondaryFeatureName)

creates html elements for the secondary feature editor and adds select options for the secondary features

Arguments:

  • primaryFeatureName (string) – Key for the primary feature editor to which the secondary feature list is getting attached to

  • secondaryFeatureName (string) – Key for the secondary feature

openUrbsEditorList(e, listName, hasEditor)

Function gets called when one of the tablink buttons in the GUI gets pressed and opens the relevant feature list, while hiding all other GUI elements

Arguments:

  • e (event) – object for the onclick event of the clicked tablink button, necassary to change the button to active

  • listName (string) – key to access the relevant list tab html element by id

  • hasEditor (boolean) – some features (like global) do not have a separate editor which means that the section of the code that opens previously open editors doesn’t apply to them. This boolean acts as a flag to ensure that portion is not called

resetLoadBusStyle(target)

function that switches bus styles back to default once they are deselected when the user clicks on another node on the map or another element in the list

Arguments:

  • target (event_target_object) – the leaflet object whose onclick method has been triggered via click on the map or selection via the list

highlightSelectedElementInList(target, selectId)

Method that changes the selectedIndex of a given select element to the option corresponding to the onclick event target

Arguments:

  • target (event_target_object) – the leaflet object whose onclick method has been triggered via click on the map or selection via the list

  • selectId (string) – id of the relevant html element

fillSelectedEditor(sel, featureName)

An aggregate function that calls the relevant editor fill method for each feature and makes sure other editor windows are closeds

Arguments:

  • sel (HTML_select_element) – gets passed as “this” reference when the onchange method for the select element is called, needed to retrieve the currently selected secondary feature

  • featureName (string) – key for corresponding html element and call of correct editor fill method

fillSelectedFeatureEditorFields(target, featureName)

Function that fills each input field of a single feature once the editor window is opened

Arguments:

  • target (dict) – Object that contains all current input values for a single feature

  • featureName (string) – key used to access the html elements

getUrbsPropertiesJSON()

getter function for the UrbsPropertiesJSON

Returns:

urbs properties dict
